answers.a: The ratio of the electric field to the magnetic field
answers.b: The measure of a material's ability to store electrical energy in an electric field
answers.c: The resistance offered by a material to current flow
answers.d: The frequency at which a material resonates

questions.question: What property defines a ferroelectric material?

answers.b: It has a low thermal conductivity
answers.c: It is non-magnetic and does not respond to an electric field
answers.d: It possesses a permanent electric dipole that can be reversed by an external electric field

answers.a: The temperature at which a ferroelectric material loses its ferroelectric properties and becomes paraelectric
answers.b: The temperature at which a ferroelectric material becomes superconductive
answers.c: The melting point of the ceramic material
answers.d: The point at which the material becomes transparent

questions.question: Which of the following materials is commonly known to be ferroelectric?
What is the significance of measuring the dielectric constant in ferroelectric ceramics?

answers.a: To measure the electrical resistance of the ceramic
answers.b: To determine the thermal stability of the ceramic
answers.c: To understand the ceramic’s ability to store electrical energy
answers.d: To find the magnetic properties of the ceramic
